title: Chinese unification
summary: Chinese unification, also known as the Cross-Strait unification or Chinese reunification, is the potential unification of territory currently controlled (and/or claimed) by the People's Republic of China and the Republic of China under one political entity, possibly the formation of a political union between the two republics. Together with full Taiwan independence, unification is one of the main proposals to address questions on the political status of Taiwan, which is a central focus of Cross-Strait relations.
